metadata.data_source: Soil & Land Use Survey of India + SHC Cycle-II + Zone Analysis

green_zone.name: Green Zone (Sufficient Iron)
green_zone.description: Most of Kanker tehsil with sufficient iron

red_spot.name: Red Spot (Deficient Iron)
red_spot.description: Small red spot area with deficient iron

green_zone.name: Green Zone (Sufficient Zinc)
green_zone.description: Majority tehsil forest cover with sufficient zinc

center_southwest.name: Red Zone Center-Southwest
center_southwest.description: Center-southwest red cluster with deficient zinc

northeast.name: Red Zone Northeast
northeast.description: Northeast borders red highlights with deficient zinc

northwest.name: Red Zone Northwest
northwest.description: Northwest border red zone with deficient zinc

green_zone.name: Green Zone (Normal pH)
green_zone.description: Forest cover, dense vegetation with normal soil pH

orange_zone.name: Orange Zone (Slightly Acidic)
orange_zone.description: Cultivated land, open area with slightly acidic soil pH

grey_zone.name: Grey Zone (Moderately Acidic)
grey_zone.description: Special features, mining zone with moderately acidic soil pH

recommendations.yellow_zone_villages: Moderate nitrogen application recommended (urea 50-75 kg/ha, DAP 25-40 kg/ha)
recommendations.red_zone_villages: Excellent soil health, maintain current levels with minimal intervention (urea 20-30 kg/ha only)
recommendations.priority_areas: Yellow zone villages with population <1000 and nitrogen <300 kg/ha
recommendations.better_areas: Red zone villages - Kondagaon, Gad Pichhawadi, Potgaon and surrounding areas
recommendations.zone_wise_strategy: Different agricultural strategies for Yellow vs Red zones

fertilizer_recommendations.yellow_zone: Urea: 50-75 kg/ha, DAP: 25-40 kg/ha, MOP: 20-30 kg/ha
fertilizer_recommendations.red_zone: Urea: 20-30 kg/ha, DAP: 15-25 kg/ha, MOP: 15-20 kg/ha

phosphorus_recommendations.Low: Apply DAP 50-75 kg/ha or SSP 100-150 kg/ha. Focus on phosphorus-deficient areas.
phosphorus_recommendations.Medium: Apply DAP 25-40 kg/ha or SSP 50-80 kg/ha. Maintain current levels.
phosphorus_recommendations.High: Monitor levels, minimal application of phosphorus fertilizer (e.g., DAP 10-20 kg/ha if needed).
phosphorus_recommendations.Very High: No phosphorus application needed. Focus on other nutrients.

potassium_recommendations.Low: Apply Muriate of Potash (MOP) 60-80 kg/ha or Sulphate of Potash (SOP) 70-90 kg/ha.
potassium_recommendations.Medium: Apply Muriate of Potash (MOP) 30-50 kg/ha or Sulphate of Potash (SOP) 35-55 kg/ha.
potassium_recommendations.High: Monitor potassium levels; apply maintenance dose if needed (10-20 kg/ha MOP).
potassium_recommendations.Very High: No potassium application needed. Focus on other nutrients.

boron_recommendations.Low: Apply Borax 5-10 kg/ha or Solubor 1-2 kg/ha. Critical for crop development.
boron_recommendations.Deficient: Apply Borax 10-15 kg/ha or Solubor 2-3 kg/ha. Essential for flowering and fruiting.
boron_recommendations.Sufficient: Monitor boron levels; apply maintenance dose if needed (Borax 2-5 kg/ha).
boron_recommendations.High: No boron application needed. Monitor for toxicity symptoms.

zone_wise_boron_strategy.Red Zone (Deficient Boron): Deficient boron - priority areas for boron application
zone_wise_boron_strategy.Low Areas: Critical areas requiring immediate boron supplementation

iron_recommendations.Low: Apply Ferrous Sulphate 25-50 kg/ha or Chelated Iron 1-2 kg/ha.
iron_recommendations.Deficient: Apply Ferrous Sulphate 50-75 kg/ha or Chelated Iron 2-3 kg/ha. Critical for chlorophyll formation.
iron_recommendations.Sufficient: Monitor iron levels; apply maintenance dose if needed (Ferrous Sulphate 10-25 kg/ha).
iron_recommendations.High: No iron application needed. Monitor for toxicity symptoms.

zone_wise_iron_strategy.Red Spot (Deficient Iron): Deficient iron - priority area for iron application

zinc_recommendations.Low: Apply Zinc Sulphate 25-50 kg/ha or Chelated Zinc 1-2 kg/ha.
zinc_recommendations.Deficient: Apply Zinc Sulphate 50-75 kg/ha or Chelated Zinc 2-3 kg/ha. Critical for enzyme activity.
zinc_recommendations.Sufficient: Monitor zinc levels; apply maintenance dose if needed (Zinc Sulphate 10-25 kg/ha).
zinc_recommendations.High: No zinc application needed. Monitor for toxicity symptoms.

zone_wise_zinc_strategy.Red Zone Center-Southwest: Deficient zinc - priority area for zinc application
zone_wise_zinc_strategy.Red Zone Northeast: Deficient zinc - priority area for zinc application
zone_wise_zinc_strategy.Red Zone Northwest: Deficient zinc - priority area for zinc application

soil_ph_recommendations.Low: Apply lime 2-4 tons/ha to raise pH. Critical for nutrient availability.
soil_ph_recommendations.Moderately Acidic: Apply lime 1-2 tons/ha or dolomite lime for magnesium deficiency.
soil_ph_recommendations.Slightly Acidic: Apply lime 0.5-1 ton/ha or organic matter to improve pH.
soil_ph_recommendations.Normal: Maintain current pH with organic matter and balanced fertilization.
soil_ph_recommendations.Slightly Alkaline: Apply sulfur or acid-forming fertilizers if needed.
soil_ph_recommendations.Moderately Alkaline: Apply gypsum and sulfur to reduce alkalinity.

zone_wise_ph_strategy.Green Zone (Normal pH): Normal pH - maintain with organic matter
zone_wise_ph_strategy.Grey Zone (Moderately Acidic): Moderately acidic - priority area for lime application

data_quality.source: Soil & Land Use Survey of India + SHC Cycle-II + Zone Analysis
data_quality.methodology: Bounding box zone assignment + Realistic nutrient ranges

coordinate_accuracy.method: Random generation within Kanker tehsil boundaries
coordinate_accuracy.disclaimer: Coordinates are approximate for planning purposes only
